titles.title: Gädlä Kiros “Vita of Kiros” / Krǝstos zä-bezawinä zä-rägäzuki bä-rämḫ bä-mälǝʿltä mäsqäl... “Christ, you who are our Redemptor, you who they pierced with a spear on the cross...” / Mǝśṭirä ṣǝgeyat “Mystery of the Flowers” / Ṣalotä ˤǝṭan “Prayer of Incense” / Commemorative notice and ʾarke-hymn dedicated to St. Roch / Prayer of Susǝnyos / Excerpt from ʾAsmat zä-Sälomon-prayer / Mäṣḥafä nuzaze “Book of Confession”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Kiros “Vita of Kiros” (fols. 3ra-39vb) II) Krǝstos zä-bezawinä zä-rägäzuki bä-rämḫ bä-mälǝʿǝltä mäsqäl... “Christ, you who are our Redemptor, you who they pierced with a spear on the cross...” (fol. 40ra-rb) III) Mǝśṭirä ṣǝgeyat “Mystery of the Flowers” (fols. 41ra-51va) IV) Ṣalotä ˤǝṭan “Prayer of Incense” (fols. 51va-61va) V) Commemorative notice and ʿarke-hymn for the 23rd of Miyazya dedicated to St. Roch (Roqo) (fols. 61va-62va) VI) Prayer of Susǝnyos (fols. 62vb-64vb) VII) Excerpt from the prayer ʾAsmat zä-Sälomon (fols. 64vb-65ra) VIII) Mäṣḥafä nuzaze “Book of Confession” (fols. 65rb-73vb)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: Only the second part of the name of the scribe (Maryam) has been retained in the supplication formula on fol. 39vb. The first part has been replaced by the name of one of the donors, ʾAśratä Maryam.

donors.donor: The name(s) of the original donor(s) has been erased throughout the Ms. and replaced with the names of ʾAśratä Maryam, ʾAśratä Ṣǝyon and Ṣǝge Dǝngǝl in the concluding supplication on fol. 73vb. Their names and one more name have been also added into the supplication formulas: ʾAśratä Maryam (fols. 3ra, 40rb, 51rb-51va, 62rb, 62va, 65ra), ʾAśratä Ṣǝyon (fols. 39va, 62ra, 62va, 65ra), Maryamawit (fols. 31ra, 39vb, 63ra) and Ṣǝge Dǝngǝl (fols. 57vb, 61va, 64vb), in a secondary hand, in vivid red.

dcomments.dcomment: Patriarch of Alexandria (liqä ṗaṗasat) ʾabba Matewos (in tenure 1660-75), Metropolitan (ṗaṗas) ʾabba Sinoda (in tenure 1671/72–92) and King Yoḥannǝs (I, r. 1667-82) are mentioned in the supplications on fol. 52ra. King Yoḥannǝs is also mentioned in the supplication on fol. 55rb and Metropolitan ʾabba Sinoda on fol. 56ra.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been resewn with a modern synthetic thread. The leather cover is missing. Numerous fols. are stained with wax and/or water.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the leather cover is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of rows of small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one pair close to the head and one pair close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(6/fols. 35r-40v) – VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – IX(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 65r-72v) – X(4/fols. 73r-76v) – B(3; s.l.: 2; stub after 2/fols. 77r-79v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: In the letter ጵ the hook vowel marker is attached to the left side of the stroke: fol. 37rb.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the patriarch, metropolitan and king; names of the donors; a few lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page of Texts I and III; one or two initial lines of Texts IV-VIii; sections of Text IV introduced with the words ṣälotä (fol. 51va) or ṣälotä ˤǝṭan and a few other words (fols. 57v, 58r); words sälam on fol. 40ra and ṣälot on fol. 57vb; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Texts V-VII concern protective and healing practices: Text V, Commemorative notice and sälam-hymn for the 23rd of Miyazya dedicated to St. Roch, is used against various diseases. Text VI, Prayer of Susǝnyos, protects pregnant women and newly-born children agains demons. Text VII, Excerpt from ʾAsmat zä-Sälomon-prayer, is used against pain in legs. - For a text similar to Mäṣḥafä nuzaze “Book of Confession”, called ʾAnqäṣä nǝssǝḥa “The Gate of Penitence, s. Ms. GKM-007 Additio 1.

additional.cont: Fol. 3r-v: Prayer to Jesus Christ.
additional.det: The prayer is written in a very poor hand; the part on fol. 3r is illegible.

additional.cont: Fol. 40rb-va: ˀAsmat-prayer.
additional.det: The note contains an ʾAsmat-prayer called sälotä ʾarwe, recited upon people bitten by a snake.

additional.cont: Fols. 74ra-75ra: Ṭǝntä lǝdätomu lä-mänäkosat “Origin of the Monks”.
additional.det: The text is written in a hand similar to the main hand. The last eight lines (fol. 75ra l.3-10), which concern the monks of Tänsǝḥe, were added later in a crude hand.

extras.extra: - Fols. 1r-2v are made of a fragment of a 16th-cent. (?) Psalter. - Correction written over erasure, in the main hand: fols. 9va, 13ra, 15rb, 17ra, 18rb, 24ra, 25rb, 29vb, 31va, 33vb, 37va, 44va, 56va, 62rb, 72rb. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 8ra, 8vb, 10va, 25va, 44va, 66va. - Omitted letter written in the margin, in a secondary hand: fol. 66rb. - A name has been erased from fol. 70rb. - Pen trial: 79r. - Minor notes, scribbles: fols. 4r, 73v, 74r, 76rb, 77r, 79r. - Writing exercises (including syllabary), in the same crude hand: 75v-76v, 77v, 78v, 79rv.
